definition: Junker (German aristocracy)/Jean-Claude Juncker (1954-), Luxembourgish politician, prime minister of Luxembourg 1995-2013, president of the European Commission 2014-2019
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: The Prussian Junker is the road-hog of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 普鲁士容克就是欧洲的路霸。

sentences.english: During the meeting Juncker delightedly recalled his five visits to China.
sentences.chinese: 容克在会见时愉快地回忆了他5次访华的情景。

sentences.english: In the manor of Junker, the farmers were still in semi-serf status.
sentences.chinese: 在容克庄园中，雇农仍然处于半农奴的地位。

sentences.english: During their talks, Huang Ju and Juncker exchanged views mainly on promoting economic and trade cooperation. Huang Ju made the following proposals.
sentences.chinese: 黄菊和容克在会谈中着重就促进经贸合作交换了看法。

sentences.english: 'I don't see any default problem in Euope,' said Mr. Juncker.
sentences.chinese: 容克说，我看欧洲不会出现任何违约问题。

sentences.english: Junker and her neighbors had packed their bags, ready to evacuate at a moment's notice.
sentences.chinese: 容克和她的邻居们收拾行李，准备撤离在片刻的通知。

sentences.english: 'I can't say I'm more  optimistic than I was before coming here,' Mr. Juncker added later.
sentences.chinese: 容克后来又说，我不能说我比来这里之前更加乐观了。

sentences.english: Juncker spoke highly of the important role China has played in international affairs.
sentences.chinese: 容克赞赏中国在国际事务中所发挥的重要作用。

definition: Angela Merkel (1954-), German CDU politician, chancellor from 2005
Franco (name)/Generalissimo Francisco Franco Bahamonde (1892-1975), Spanish dictator and head of state 1939-1975
Bismarck (name)/Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, Minister-President of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890
Ursula von der Leyen (1958-), German politician, president of the European Commission from 2019
Foreign Secretary/(UK) Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs
Winston Churchill (1874-1965), UK politican and prime minister 1940-1945 and 1951-1955/surname Churchill
to withdraw from the European Union/abbr. for 脫離歐盟|脱离欧盟
